CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: It can be observed that the open circuit voltages of cells fabricated using PFDTBT and its ter-polymers range from 0.70 to 0.77 V. The device fabricated using PFDTBT showed higher open circuit voltages than those of perylene-containing copolymers.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PFDTBT |
| PFDTBT's ter-polymers |
| perylene-containing copolymers |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: It can be observed that the open circuit voltages of cells fabricated using PFDTBT and its ter-polymers range from 0.70 to 0.77 V. The device fabricated using PFDTBT showed higher open circuit voltages than those of perylene-containing copolymers.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| open circuit voltages |
| higher open circuit voltages |

Explanation:

The paragraph mentions two types of properties related to the voltage of cells: "open circuit voltages" and "higher open circuit voltages." These are the "Property Name" entities in the text. The term "higher" is considered a comparative adjective and is included in the entity to provide context. The entities are presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name."

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| open circuit voltages |

Explanation:

After reevaluating the paragraph, only one clear "Material Property" entity is found: "open circuit voltages." The term "higher open circuit voltages" is not a clear "Material Property" entity since it is a comparative statement and lacks a clear reference to a specific material. Therefore, it is not included in the final table.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: It can be observed that the open circuit voltages of cells fabricated using PFDTBT and its ter-polymers range from 0.70 to 0.77 V. The device fabricated using PFDTBT showed higher open circuit voltages than those of perylene-containing copolymers.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 0.70 V |
| 0.77 V |
| higher open circuit voltages |

In this paragraph, the "Property Value" entities refer to the specific voltage values associated with the open circuit voltages of certain cells. The first two entities are the voltage ranges for cells fabricated using PFDTBT and its ter-polymers, which are 0.70 V and 0.77 V, respectively. The third entity is the higher open circuit voltages of the device fabricated using PFDTBT compared to perylene-containing copolymers.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 0.70 V |
| 0.77 V |

In this revised list, I have removed the entity "higher open circuit voltages" since it is a comparative statement rather than a specific value of a material property. The remaining two entities, 0.70 V and 0.77 V, are specific voltage values associated with the open circuit voltages of certain cells and are therefore considered to be values of material properties.
